content.description: Start with your hands crossed low on the diagonal crack. Do some crossing and use some heel/toe hooks to move left along the crack to a decent left hand pinch and a throw to the good crystal in the dish. From there an undercling/sidepull gets you to gaston crimps and out onto the face, next few moves are crimpy, with jugs for the topout. There is no rest to be had anywhere really, there is a pretty big move on the face, and the landing is absolute trash. Mental game has to be on point for this one.
content.location: To the left of Leave it to Jesus, just to the right of the big crack in the middle of the Meth lab boulder.

content.description: Start underneath the obvious projecting boulder behind Octernal. Good start holds. Bump around the lip and heal up to finish.
Sit start, move straight up the slabby face and topout on the knife edge.
content.location: Uphill from octurnal in the inner sanctum. Left of swollen member. Probably easier to approach from Azian Crack.

content.description: Stand start on undercling pinches or an optional left hand crimp and move up through a good right hand pinch and lateral crimps to a fun top out. Tenuous feet and movement characterize this boulder. Movement feels a solid notch harder than Octernal.
content.protection: At least 2 pads. More isn’t a bad option since the landing is covered in roots and small rocks
content.location: Leftmost route on the octernal wall. Start is about 5 feet left of the octernal topout.  Line is often wet.

climbs.name: Slam Dunk
climbs.fa: Peter Brink? Some time in the early 2000s

content.description: Start low matched on the crimp rail. Work two or three easy moves up on the good hands and poor feet. Dunk on the sloper up and right. A high foot leads to an easy topout.An old classic from the early 2000s, covered with moss for years and recently re-cleaned. Superb rock quality and movement. Its only flaw is that its so short.Safe with one pad, but take care not to dab on it.
content.protection: One pad is all you need.
content.location: In the pass on the West side of the Meth Lab Boulder. A steep overhang on the north side of the pass. Start with feet all the way down, hands matched on the lowest crimp rail (about 1 full pad, not the larger rail up and to the right). This is not on the meth lab boulder itself, but the boulder across the trail from the meth lab.

content.description:
Begin as for Octernal, but avoid the pumpy traverse after the lip by transitioning onto the right side face and climbing straight up into a spicy top out. 

  Probably easier than the main route since it skips the traverse, the crux of both routes comes before the lip though.
content.location: On the meth lab boulder opposite the road

content.description:
One of the most popular boulders in the garden.  Start low in the cave, left hand sloper and right hand on a small crimp SDS.  Grunge your way up a hard v7/8 to a small heel hook rest.  Then traverse left on a rail system to the left most side of the boulder, traverse around 20 ft to the left after completing the initial cave.   If you start standing with both hands on the large undercling, the line goes at about V5/6. 

  One of the 5 hard lines left at sweethome.
content.protection: Pads, at least 2 or 3 and a spotter.
content.location: In the very center of the garden, you will pass a large tree and enter a cave like area surrounded by boulders.  Octenal is on the backside of this huge house sized boulder.  One of the best a sweethome.

content.description:
Start sitting with uncomfortably high feet and two seemingly impossible razor sharp crimps; a couple of hard, crimpy, dynamic, precision moves leads into better holds.

 This goes from a stand at v1
Starts on the blocky pinch that you dyno to on Leary's Lunge. Traverse right and top out as for Octernal Direct.
Start either of the very low opposing sidepulls or left hand on the jug of Heisenberg and right hand down. Dyno up and right to a flat jug.
content.location: Right next to Octurnal on the Meth Lab boulder

content.description: Start low on opposing edges and move up and left through bad right hand slopers and a single left hand crimp.
content.location: On the left side of the Meth Lab boulder (about 25 feet left of Octurnal and on the same boulder)

content.description: This thing seems hard for v7 but what do I know I haven't gotten it yet. Start matched on a crimp rail at chest height. Make a deep lock off right to a positive hold and finish out the boulder with a couple more manageable moves on bad holds. It's kinda fun
content.location: Gently overhanging face to the right of Octernal

content.description: Start holds are 3-5 ft to the right of Octernal's right hand start hold. Sit start on a left facing diagonal crimp, a right hand facing sidepull and a high left heel hook. Finesse your way up to a good horizontal crimp, then out right to a vertical rail/flake, good holds from there to the top.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Octernal.

content.description: The methlab is the most obvious formation in the area. Look for the huge overhanging prow which is visible from the road. The back side of this boulder (and its surrounding formations) hosts many classic routes including Octurnal.
